Reviews.Content: Perfect Honeymoon Destination This was a great escape from the business of Rome and Florence. We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Our room was very clean and spacious. We were honeymooning and it provided the perfect ambiance for us. We enjoyed the spa - hot tub and sauna. We didn't try the pool. Everything was very well taken care of. The restaurant is delicious.
Reviews.Author: DennisSanDiego

Reviews.Content: Our heaven on earth!       sitting on the private porch by noon...
Reviews.Author: Roosmarijn

Reviews.Content: Romantic and Relaxing After a really long exhausting trip, we weren't able to check in until 10pm and they welcomed us with a wonderful dinner and made us feel like we just got home. The staff was wonderful!!! Thank you especially to Alessio and Simona who took extra special care of us. Their restaurant is not open for lunch so make sure you plan to rent a car or buy groceries if you plan to hang out there during the day. The breakfast is great and the dinner is EXTRA special, romantic and VERY delicious! We arrived in Tuscany and spent 4 nights here before our wedding in Cortona and it was the perfect place to unwind, relax and feel like you're in Italy. Our room, Torino, was super cool...lots of character and the fireplace made it extra cozy.
Reviews.Author: Hvalfangst

Reviews.Content: Scorpion in room; Gym/Spa is ridiculously overpriced The resort itself is lovely, although the rooms are fairly basic. We had a scorpion in our room which made it difficult to relax. We tried to eat outside but were covered in bees and bugs. One of the reasons we chose this resort was because of the gym. However, upon arrival we discovered that the gym is outrageously expensive. And you can't even use the bathroom in the gym when you are sitting by the pool--you have to walk all the way back to reception. Most of the staff were really friendly but we were given horrible directions one day and spent half the day lost. I would highly recommend the cooking class--it was excellent. The breakfast is average and overpriced (it sits out all night waiting for breakfast). The resort doesn't serve lunch and nothing is in walking distance so you have to get groceries (but here is no oven or toaster) or drive 15 mins into the nearest town. We enjoyed our trip but thought the attempts to squeeze money out of you at every turn put a damper on it.
Reviews.Author: SandALondon

Reviews.Content: Perfect location, perfect accomadations, perfect staff My husband and another couple spent two glorious weeks at Monsignor Della Casa..We found the accomadations to be just what we hoped for and more..We stayed in the Fratoio 2 villa..the kitchen had all the necessary equipment but we ate out most of the time..Enjoyed the restaurant on site..especially Simone who ran the dinner hours..We found the staff exceptionally helpful in getting us reservations for restaurants and museums..They even arranged for a wine tasting at Castle Trebbio...We were blessed with warm and sunny weather and found the location to be convenient to all the sights we wished to visit...the train from Borgo San Lorenzo was a 40 to 50 minute ride to Florence..the highway from Barberino de Muggello took us south to Sienna and West to Lucca without any difficulty...we also enjoyed the surrounding Muggello region...a very special place, staffed by some very special people..We can't wait to return...
Reviews.Author: nanub

Reviews.Content: Great Stay! We had a great stay at Monsignor della Casa. It is in a beautiful setting, good restaurant and the grounds are so well kept. Everyone on the staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a great vacation there with our 2 year old! The only downfall is that the resort is a good distance from many of the popular Tuscan towns, but we enjoyed visiting some of the smaller, lesser known towns in the area.
Reviews.Author: ensignm

Reviews.Content: Heaven in Tuscany I was in Monsignore last June and it was a perfect stay.The place is quite close to the most important towns in Tuscany: Florence, Lucca, Pisa, Sienna, Lighorn, San Gimignano...so it is a really full immersion in arts!The restaurant is pretty good with Tuscan food and special like truffle or Florentine steak.I was there with my girlfriend in Pontormo apartment, very good for 2 persons...with a kitchnette, a fridge and a very big shower...The staff made the difference! Everybody is perfect and helpfull: Anna you are wonderful and the sweetiest, Valantina always smiling and Serina so friendly.Many thanks for making our stay so special. We will come back for sure!
Reviews.Author: SuperMan78

Reviews.Content: Great Holiday Great Stay, lovely staff with a peronal touch. Restaurant with local menu's esp the Pasta menu is perfect. Sport activities like football, volley, welness and bike. Children want to return!
Reviews.Author: PaoloVecchiaDiga

Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay
Reviews.Author: tillymanilly

Reviews.Content: Great villa at a reasonable price - close to Florence       Monsignor della Casa - Our villa on left
Reviews.Author: ghoth

Reviews.Content: peaceful resort - great for the kids too we have just returned from a week at frantoio 2 villa in Monsignore della casa. Perfect week. They have thought of everything even down to blackout curtains to keep the little ones from waking too early! the staff were extemely helpful. Our friends baby was crawling at quite a speed and they erected a temporary barrier to stop him crawling into the neighboring villas pool.would recommend to friends.
Reviews.Author: scubagoose

Reviews.Content: Wonderful!!!! A beautiful resort in an idyllic setting. Our stay was everything we hoped for- beautiful setting, wonderful accomodations and a staff that exceeded all of our expectations. We cannot wait to return again and again. Thanks to Alessio and his staff for a warm, wonderful stay!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great stay We are fussy about where we stay and spent a lot of time researching before we decided to book this place. We had a great 6 days there. The staff were great, the facilities excellent and the food very good. It was easy to get to lots of places from there. We had a 4 year old with us and he had a great time. Things to look out for - apartments are all different sizes so check what size and aspect you are getting. The pools are unheated but this was not a problem for us due to the excellent weather.
Reviews.Author: Gareth46

Reviews.Content: Honeymoon in Tuscany My husband and I stayed at Monsignor della Casa Country Resort on our honeymoon in November 2005. The villa's were very nice, very clean and comfortable. We stayed in the villa called 'Botticelli', perfect for 2 adults. It had it's own small kitchen separate bedroom and lounge room, open log fire which you get to light and stoke yourself (my husband loved that part)!!The country resort is approximately 5 minutes drive to Borgo San Lorenzo, the closest town. Not much there!!We loved our villa however the location in Tuscany was not the best, I think the country side was better over near Siena and San Gimiano.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
